channel.title: Question about an external hard drive
channel.description: Would buying a 500GB external hard drive make my server run faster and less laggy and keeping the uptime up more? Here's what I'm planning on buying: http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?skuId=8908658&type=product&id=1216424110325

item.title: Question about an external hard drive
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:14, topic:282038”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=372680.msg2812379#msg2812379 date=1244067517]
$60-$100.
[/quote]
Ah you see, I’ve found one for $119.99,

1TB (1024GB)
34MB Cache
7200RPMs

http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?skuId=9238121&type=product&id=1218065495073#tabbed-customerreviews

i have 4gb of ram and i still lag on my server 317 with coustoms only and 508s

What OS? and 32-Bit or 64-Bit?[/quote]

And you’re sure that this will improve my server performance? I really don’t want to go out and buy this if it won’t. You know this for a fact?

Read full topic

item.source: Question about an external hard drive

item.title: Question about an external hard drive
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

runefreak10:

Would buying a 500GB external hard drive make my server run faster and less laggy and keeping the uptime up more? Here’s what I’m planning on buying: http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?skuId=8908658&type=product&id=1216424110325

It would increase the compile time (Taking into account that the RPM of the external drive is faster then the RPM of the internal drive), You would also want a larger Buffer Cache Size, as this is the temporary storage area used to enhance drive performance, as the computer requests data from your HDD, if the data is in the cache you get a performance boost related to the speed of the cache. The larger the Buffer Cache Size should result in better performance.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about an external hard drive

item.title: Question about an external hard drive
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

And something about this so I don’t have to make a new topic. What does this mean in my server window?

[KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server!
Here’s the code round that message in my server class:

totalTimeSpentProcessing += timeSpent; if (timeSpent >= cycleTime) { timeSpent = cycleTime; if (++waitFails > 100) { // shutdownServer = true; misc.println( "[KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server!"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Question about an external hard drive
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

runefreak10:

I’ve recently gotten an extra GB of RAM. I don’t want a VPS because I’d have to pay monthly and if I buy a home server that’s like $500-$800 and I don’t want to do that. What else could I do?

Stock up on RAM, and use a stable source.

Read full topic
